A: Section A: Objective Questions
1. Professor Wole Soyinka was born in the year _? (a) 1986 (b) 1934 (c) 1967 (d) 1991
2. Wole Soyinka was the first African to win the Nobel Prize in _? (a) Peace (b) Literature (c) Science (d) Economics
3. Professor Wole Soyinka was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in _ (a) 1934 (b) 1986 (c) 1991 (d) 1996
4. Wole Soyinka was born into a _ family (a) Igbo (b) Hausa (c) Yoruba (d) Fulani
5. Professor Wole Soyinka was born in _ (a) Lagos (b) Abuja (c) Abeokuta (d) Kano
6. Wole Soyinka was born on July _ (a) 13 (b) 27 (c) 3 (d) 1
7. Wole Soyinka is known as a poet, playwright, and _ writer (a) novel (b) essay (c) short story (d) drama
8. Wole Soyinka was imprisoned for criticizing the _ government (a) British (b) Nigerian (c) American (d) French
9. Nigeria has _ states (a) 27 (b) 30 (c) 36 (d) 50
10. The Federal Capital Territory is part of Nigeria's states True or False?
11. States are created for easy _ (a) travel (b) administration (c) trade (d) education
12. Creating states helps bring government closer to the _ (a) leaders (b) people (c) military (d) schools
13. Abia State capital is _ (a) Umuahia (b) Yola (c) Uyo (d) Awka
14. Adamawa State capital is _ (a) Umuahia (b) Yola (c) Uyo (d) Awka
15. Akwa Ibom State capital is _ (a) Umuahia (b) Yola (c) Uyo (d) Awka
16. Anambra State capital is _ (a) Umuahia (b) Yola (c) Uyo (d) Awka
17. Bauchi State capital is _ (a) Bauchi (b) Yenegoa (c) Makurdi (d) Maiduguri
18. Bayelsa State capital is _ (a) Bauchi (b) Yenegoa (c) Makurdi (d) Maiduguri
19. Benue State capital is _ (a) Bauchi (b) Yenegoa (c) Makurdi (d) Maiduguri
20. Borno State capital is _ (a) Bauchi (b) Yenegoa (c) Makurdi (d) Maiduguri
21. Cross River State capital is _ (a) Calabar (b) Asaba (c) Abakaliki (d) Benin
22. Delta State capital is _ (a) Calabar (b) Asaba (c) Abakaliki (d) Benin
23. Ebonyi State capital is _ (a) Calabar (b) Asaba (c) Abakaliki (d) Benin
24. Edo State capital is _ (a) Calabar (b) Asaba (c) Abakaliki (d) Benin
25. Ekiti State capital is Ado-Ekiti True or False?
26. Enugu State capital is Enugu True or False?
27. Gombe State was created on October 1, _ (a) 1991 (b) 1996 (c) 1987 (d) 1976
28. Imo State was created on February 3, _ (a) 1991 (b) 1996 (c) 1987 (d) 1976
29. Jigawa State was created on August 27, _ (a) 1991 (b) 1996 (c) 1987 (d) 1976
30. Kaduna State was created on May 27, _ (a) 1991 (b) 1996 (c) 1987 (d) 1967
B: 1. Wole Soyinka received the Nobel Prize in which year? _________
2. In what city was Wole Soyinka born? _________
3. How many states are in Nigeria? _________
4. What is the capital of Cross River State? _________
5. What is the capital of Lagos State? _________
C: 1. Name the first African Nobel laureate in Literature.
2. State one reason why states are created in Nigeria.
3. List two roles Wole Soyinka played in Nigeria's history.
4. What is the primary purpose of state creation in Nigeria?
5. When was Akwa Ibom State created?
answers_C: Criticizing Nigeria government, active roles in Nigeria's political history.
To bring government closer to the people.
